Description:
Space, Convenience and Parkland
A peaceful, secure and low-maintenance lifestyle awaits with this European-style town residence affording spacious living and a practical floorplan in a convenient inner-city parkland pocket. Offering three big bedrooms (main with ensuite, built-in-robe and study alcove, walk-in-robe and built-in-robe in the other two), separate living and dining rooms with new carpet throughout, well-appointed kitchen with granite bench tops, bathroom with twin vanity and separate toilet, powder room and concealed laundry, courtyard, plus prized double lock up garage. Also features loads of storage, alarm, central heating and cooling. Moments from sporting fields, bike/walking tracks and Dights Falls plus close to Spensley Street Village, Clifton Hill train station, Abbotsford Covenant, schools, freeway access and the CBD.
Note: No Owners Corporation
Leonard Siragusa : 0407 875 048

Description:
Elegant Double Storey Balcony Terrace
This elegant double storey balcony terrace with exceptional heritage appeal stands out in an area renowned for its great period homes. In rendered Hawthorn brick circa 1885, comprising six rooms, extensive renovations offer family sized comfort and luxury while maintaining many original period features including arched hallway, original polished floors and staircase, sash windows, ornamental ceilings and polished marble open fireplaces. A ground floor veranda tessellated tile restoration. Semi-detached in the row of four, the north facing home has remote controlled B&D roller door car parking from access at rear. The upstairs balcony is polished Western Australian hardwood . There's an alarm system and video intercom. Land size is 27.5m deep x 6.1m wide frontage providing 167 sqm approx.
The ultra-modern separate kitchen and dining room has top of the range Fisher & Paykel appliances throughout, CaesarStone benchtops, Blanco Claronline sink, electric Blum cupboards, plus Quasair rangehood and a European laundry with significant storage. There are two stylish bathrooms. Year-round comfort is assured with gas heater and LG split system air conditioning and heating in main bedrooms and living and dining areas, supported by batt and foil insulation. Windows and doors are double-glazed. Side access leads past a long timber deck into a low maintenance courtyard garden.
It's just a short stroll to Darling Gardens and Clifton Hill village cafes, restaurants and two of the state's best primary schools. Trains and trams provide easy city access. But here you truly enjoy the best of both worlds, with escape to the vast Yarra Bend parks precinct virtually on the doorstep, featuring exhilarating Yarra and Merri Creek Trails and the city's best golf courses. This is Melbourne at its most livable.
Property Code: 4838

Description:
TEMPTING BALCONY TERRACE, VIBRANT VILLAGE LOCAL
Standing at the heart of the village convenient to all the inner-city has to offer, this Victorian balcony terrace presents an incredibly enticing opportunity. Situated on the corner of a distinctive heritage row, this original character-laden home has remained largely unchanged and offers rich rewards for renovators seeking a glorious restoration or stunning contemporary transformation. Retaining high ceilings, Baltic pine floorboards and open fireplaces; create the lifestyle you desire just a few minutes by train to the CBD and seconds to cafes, shops, schools and Darling Gardens. Includes three bedrooms, main bedroom opening to balcony with views, living room, dining room, large kitchen and meals area, bathroom, separate WC, laundry, storage and courtyard garden featuring a magnificent peppercorn tree.
Miles Real Estate.
Gordon Whale : 0419 335 459

Description:
Portaferry c1888 - Quietly Secluded Dual Frontage Oasis
Tucked away in a quiet, leafy service road setting with dual Rose Street frontage, 'Portaferry' c1888 is an outstanding light and bright Boom-style Victorian boasting just-completed renovations on a deep landscaped block with secure off street parking. Settle straight in to a wonderful village lifestyle and stroll to cafes, schools, parks, trams and Clifton Hill station from this exceptional terrace offering a flexible three double bedroom and study/lounge (or 4th bedroom) floorplan featuring zoned heating/cooling, heritage details and contemporary appointments. Includes arched hallway, main bedroom ensuite with retractable open air skylight, spacious living/dining (gas fireplace) with double-glazed bifold doors to secluded sandstone courtyard, brilliant stone kitchen (soft drawers/cupboards, European appliances), two bathrooms, laundry, marble open fireplaces, polished floorboards, abundant storage and coded rear access.
Andrew Simondson : 0412 999 128

Description:
Spacious, Stylish & Bright!
Situated opposite Darling Gardens this tastefully renovated first floor apartment set to the rear of the block has so much to offer. Generous accommodation comprises entry hall, large lounge, dining area and well-appointed kitchen with dishwasher. Two good sized bedrooms, with built in robes, have excellent natural light, plus a modern central bathroom and designated off street parking. With nothing to do and low overheads it presents the perfect opportunity for first homeowners or investors. The location could hardly be bettered - at the city end of Clifton Hill, within easy walking distance to tram and train transport, Queens Parade cafes and shopping, and Gold Street Primary School. Don't miss it!

Description:
GRAND BALCONIED TERRACE IN A PRIZED LOCATION!
Moments from Darling Gardens and Queens Parade cafes, this imposing Hawthorn-brick Victorian presents an enviable inner-city lifestyle opportunity. Beyond its stunning facade, the home's spacious interior comprises three generous bedrooms (master with balcony access) and updated bathroom, study or fourth bedroom, separate lounge and dining rooms, well-appointed kitchen with stainless steel cooker and walk-in pantry. Other highlights include ducted heating, a/c, open fireplaces, polished timber floors and high ornate ceilings, concealed laundry facilities, plus a fabulous entertainer's courtyard with expansive decked area. Immediately enjoyable with scope to further enhance, it's also close to Clifton Hill Primary School, Smith Street trams and easy freeway access.

Description:
PICTURE-PERFECT VICTORIAN
This handsome polychromatic brick terrace, set behind a charming cottage garden, has been stylishly renovated to maximise northerly light, in a prime street close to Village cafes and station, Queens Parade and the Darling Gardens. A classic floor plan offers two double bedrooms and a tiled bathroom (separate bath and shower) from an arched hallway, and an expansive U-shaped living, dining and kitchen zone built around a central courtyard. Features of this charming property include a concealed laundry, richly polished Baltic floors, ducted heating and quality fittings.

Description:
CITY EDGE, VILLAGE VIBE
Immaculately presented and extremely well appointed for a contemporary lifestyle, this beautiful home combines low maintenance, location and a funky warehouse edge!
- 3 large bedrooms - built in robes, master with balcony, walk in robe and reverse cycle
- Sun drenched living and dining area with reverse cycle, polished floor boards and high ceilings
- Sliding doors open to a gorgeous decked balcony
- Sleek well appointed gas kitchen - dishwasher
- Separate 2nd living area/study zone/guest bedroom opening to a gorgeous courtyard
- 2 modern bathrooms - bath, master with ensuite, living with powder room
- Concealed laundry; Feature beams throughout; Loads of storage
- Own street frontage
- Secure off street car park with internal access
Situated in an ultra convenient location, within easy walking distance to a plethora of cafes/restaurants, the wonderful Yarra River bike paths and walking trails, transport & the CBD.

Description:
It’s all about location!
Perhaps one of the more affordable property purchases within Clifton Hill, this top floor single bedroom apartment enjoys a sunny aspect, is ideally situated adjacent to acres of delightful Yarra River parkland and is only a short distance to varied public transport options and the enticing eateries Melbourne’s inner north is renowned for.
Offering a wonderful entry level opportunity for the first home buyer or investor the apartment features sizeable North facing lounge with adjoining galley kitchen, double bedroom with built in robes, tiled bathroom with shower over bath and undercover car space.
Currently leased to wonderful tenants until May 2014 returning $1,108.00 per calendar month.

Description:
Flexible & Light-Filled in Fabulous Village Locale
Opened up at the rear allowing glorious northerly light to fill a two-level extension, this superbly elevated terrace merges period appeal with modern spaces at the heart of the vibrant Clifton Hill village. Nestled in an alluring heritage row, previous renovations invite immediate living while suggesting further improvements when ready to complete a fabulous contemporary transformation. Wander to the wonderful range of nearby attractions including cafes, parklands, schools and train station from this engaging Victorian offering arched hallway, two double bedrooms, versatile upstairs retreat (third bedroom or lounge), north-oriented living/meals area, delightful kitchen, stylish bathroom and laundry area, gas heating, air-conditioner, polished floorboards and sun-drenched courtyard garden (ROW).
Nicholas Corby : 0418 512 978
Insights: 33 Fenwick Street, CLIFTON HILL VIC 3068 was last sold in 2013 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in CLIFTON HILL have recently been sold.

Description:
Charming Art Deco Revitalised ... Auction This Saturday View from 10.45
The charm of the Art Deco period has been encapsulated in the modern renovation and refurbishment of this two bedroom home on a prominent corner position allowing natural light to stream throughout each room.
A side portico provides central entry to the two spacious bedrooms each with built in robes, the main with a built in window box seat, a large formal lounge room with feature fire place, comfortable bathroom and then a modernised kitchen with adjoining meals and informal sitting area overlooking the rear paved courtyard.
You'll be able to move straight in or rent this comfortable home but more modern updates could be considered to maximise the potential of the home.
Polished floor boards, high decorative ceilings coupled with central heating and split system air-conditioners blend the old with the new and create an enviable lifestyle.
Outside there's a single carport with an adjoining garden shed that houses a water tank system to look after the yard and for extra storage there's a ceiling cavity accessed by a professionally installed ceiling ladder.
To round out the offering, consider the location ... walking distance to the Village, the station, the Merri and Yarra bike and walking trails and tucked in just behind Spensley St Primary.
E-book:
http://bit.ly/1f4wp1o
Insights: 21 Edmund Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2013 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
AUCTION THIS SATURDAY - View from 11.15am
This top floor apartment has been refurbished throughout with a contemporary kitchen, installation of reverse cycle air conditioning and being on the top floor allows natural light to permeate every room.
A security entry with intercom allows access to the upper level where an entry hall opens to a spacious lounge with northerly aspect. A second passage allows access to each of the generous bedrooms, bathroom with laundry facility and entertainers kitchen.
An undercover car space protects your vehicle as seldom would it be necessary in this coveted village locale with the station a short stroll, trams and buses a stone throw further with the surrounding greenscape including parkland, Yarra and Merri environs to enjoy.

Description:
GREEN AND PEACEFUL IN THE VILLAGE
With light from 3 sides this ground floor apartment, in a block of only 6, offers two double bedrooms (BIRs), a well-equipped eat-in kitchen with gas/electric cooking, dishwasher and huge pantry, and a bathroom with separate toilet and laundry facilities. A car space is on title and there is a communal courtyard and bike racks. Perfectly positioned to take advantage of nearby Merri Creek parklands, cafes and entertainment options on Queens Parade and Westgarth cinema and restaurants, and only minutes' walk to the train station. With nothing to do and low overheads it's suitable for first homeowners, investors and anyone wanting to take advantage of the brilliant location. [Currently rented on a monthly lease; rental $1716pcm]

Description:
HISTORIC 3 BEDROOM SHOPFRONT, GREAT POTENTIAL!
This former boot factory and butcher's shop, in a prime corner position close to Queens Parade and Brunswick Street, offers comfortable renovated living now, with exciting potential for an upper-level extension (STCA). Filled with light, the residence comprises 3 double bedrooms, separate living and dining rooms, a neat kitchen, tiled bathroom and laundry. Featuring a sunny atrium, polished timber floors, period detail, extensive storage and split-system air conditioning, this appealing property includes a deep paved courtyard with pergola and off-street parking from Hilton Street, a storage shed and second WC.

Address: 21 Heidelberg (Quiet End) Road CLIFTON HILL VIC 3068
Description:
ELEGANT EDWARDIAN WITH STUDIO AND DUAL STREET FRONTAGES
This immaculately-presented period residence, set on the quiet exit from Heidelberg Road close to Clifton Hill station and village, Queens Parade cafes and shopping, offers period charm, a versatile floor plan, and light-filled living space. The tuck-pointed fretwork- trimmed faade and pretty front garden ensure immediate street appeal. Entrance from the verandah is to a Baltic-floored hallway with exceptionally high ceilings inset with a large skylight. Three double bedrooms, a family-size tiled bathroom and separate WC run to one side. An imaginatively designed new section with complementary period detail links the well-proportioned living and dining zones, separated by a stylish black-and-white kitchen with (stainless steel appliances) and full-sized laundry. The glass-walled living area flows to a deep paved courtyard, bordered by a parking area from Rose Street and a storage room with WC.
The piece de resistance of this charming house is a vast upper level studio, with truss and gable ceiling, windows with views over Clifton Hill village, split-system air conditioning and ample storage. Used by the current owner as a design studio, the space is readily convertible to a living room/library or fourth bedroom. Here is a city-fringe home with warmth and character, ideally suited for family living or work-from-home occupancy. Land size: 6.4m x 40m

Description:
SURPRISINGLY SPACIOUS
Conveniently located close to parklands, schools, and public transport, this pretty Victorian terrace (C1880) offers excellent accommodation and maintenance-free living. Retaining many period features, such as deep cornices, ceiling roses, hall arch, original timber floors and open fireplaces, it is generously proportioned and filled with natural light. It comprises 3 bedrooms (2 with BIRs and OFPs), a central bathroom including laundry, sitting room with OFP and built in bookcase, and a rear living zone, with new polished timber floors, opening to a private, paved courtyard.
Features hydronic heating and roof storage.

Description:
VERSATILE FLOORPLAN
Filled with light, this wide Victorian residence combines mellow period detail with modern comfort, in a prime location close to transport, Smith Street, Queens Parade, and the Edinburgh and Darling Gardens. Its high-ceilinged accommodation comprises two bedrooms (main with BIRs), a home office/guest bedroom, a spacious sitting room opening through French doors to a large paved courtyard with pergola and a mature grape vine, a sunny timber kitchen open to dining area, smart tiled bathroom (spa and overbath shower), and separate laundry. Offering scope to add further value, this charming property features open fireplaces, Baltic pine finishes, gas log fire plus Vulcan heating and evaporative cooling.
Insights: 16 other 2 bedroom house in CLIFTON HILL have recently been sold.

Description:
A CENTRAL VILLAGE LANDMARK: GLORIOUS POSSIBILITIES!
This imposing building in the historic heart of Clifton Hill Village offers a once-in-a decade opportunity for redevelopment, on a vast block (368 sq.m approx) with easy ROW access from Berry Street. Built in 1901 as business premises with a grand upper level residence, it comprises a huge shopfront space, seven large principal rooms, a kitchen and bathroom. This intriguing property with city views features an eclectic blend of Art Nouveau and late Victorian architectural detail. And what a location - close to the station, fine cafes, Yarra parkland and freeway access.

Description:
The Best Of Old & New
A chic contemporary renovation has entirely transformed this charming Edwardian, creating an essentially modern low maintenance residence enhanced by superior stone finishes, remote off street parking with storage space and references to its rich period ancestry. Behind a gorgeous traditional facade, sleek and stylish proportions full of brilliant natural light perfectly match astute investment or busy lifestyle priorities close to Village shops, transport links and Yarra parklands. A double arched hall and high three metre ceilings complement two double bedrooms each with extensive built-in-robes, one with original open firpelace. Stacked stone complements a generous designer bathroom before an impressive open plan living/ dining domain with gas open fireplace and showpiece Miele kitchen bifold to an elevated alfresco deck perfect for entertaining. Includes polished timber floors, reverse cycle heating/ cooling, concealed laundry, exceptional roof storage. A real delight!
Julie Susnjara : 0408 006 662

Description:
Live Opposite Acres of Parkland
Glorious northerly views directly overlooking Quarries Park enhance the tranquil ambience of this marvellous modern European-style town residence in a convenient inner city parkland pocket. Superbly presented and filled with light; invest or relax in an excellent home and a sought-after locale near river walks, cafes, shops, schools, train, freeway and the CBD. Offers three big bedrooms (built-in-robes, main with ensuite and study alcove including verdant views), separate living and dining rooms with polished floorboards, quality kitchen, bathroom with twin vanity, powder room, concealed laundry, attic storage and reverse cycle heating and cooling. Opens to leafy landscaped courtyard garden, alfresco area and off street parking (roller door).
Andrew Simondson : 0412 999 128

Description:
PICTURESQUE AND PERFECTLY POSITIONED
This immaculately refurbished block-fronted Victorian residence close to the Village, schools, station and Yarra parklands is sure to please! In one of the areas most charming streets, the house opens from a verandah to an arched hallway, from which run two double bedrooms, with open fireplaces flanked by new built-in wardrobes. The central living and dining room, handsomely proportioned, has a fine ebonised overmantel and the original timber dado. The kitchen, with ample storage space and timber benchtops, adjoins a white-tiled bathroom/laundry. To the rear, an expansive 2-level pergola-covered deck provides secluded year-round outdoor living space. Featuring polished Baltic floors, timber dado work, open fireplaces and split-system heating and cooling throughout, this light-filled property is a Clifton Hill classic.
Insights: 16 other 2 bedroom house in CLIFTON HILL have recently been sold.
